Keywords: Fantastic Four , Ruler , Scientist
Real Name: Reed Richards
Special Powers
INTERDIMENSIONAL COUNCIL OF REEDS: Leadership. When Reed Richards Alpha uses it, give Reed Richards Alpha a number of Bridge tokens equal to half the result of his roll. // FREE: Remove 6 Bridge tokens to generate a Reed Council Member bystander.
A MULTIVERSE'S WORTH OF REED'S INVENTIONS: When Reed Richards Alpha generates a Reed Council Member bystander, choose a standard attack or damage power and note it. Reed Richards Alpha and Reed Council Member bystanders can use all powers noted in this way.
FALL OF THE COUNCIL: When a Reed Council Member bystander is KO'd, deal Reed Richards Alpha 1 unavoidable damage and an opponent chooses a noted power. The chosen power is no longer "noted" (that power may not be used in this way until "noted" again). Protected: Pulse Wave.

July 25, 2022
C-Dog
I wonder what the multiverse versions of me are like. I bet one is really good at swimming. I'm not very good. I was at the public pool once and started drowning. Luckily, the lifeguard on duty, Wendy Pfeffercorn, came and gave me CPR. It turned out that the whole thing was a setup, but it worked.....we got married and had a bunch of kids. This was after we threw up our chew and pickled the Beast. Still, best summer ever.
March 19, 2022
Coyote's Own
The Council of Reeds, for Hickman's run, predates the Council of Ricks by at least good several years. And of course, the was the council of Kangs way before that.
March 19, 2022
Bobcat2022
The degree to which this is just straight-up a HeroClix of Rick Of Rick & Morty is oddly compelling.
January 5, 2022
Fantastic_Four
I tried this guy out today, and I've gotta say I love him. Honestly, I think he's low-key amazing. If you can keep him alive until he's generated his second bystander, his influence over the board begins to explode. How befitting of Reed, too; the longer he's left to his own devices, the more powerful he becomes. With good placement and solid defense values, your opponent will be forced to choose between dedicating a lot of resources to taking him down early, or else face an army of Swiss Army Reeds late-game. The only minor complaint I have is the lack of the FF team ability on his bystanders.
December 31, 2021
Maxphyte
I had fun with this figure. His bystanders being autonomous helps out a lot as well. Ever since the F4 have been reintroduced into the game, I felt like with the exception of Cosmic Clash Reed that Reed has gotten the short stick of the F4 when it comes to decent to good figures. This Reed was way more fun to use than most of the others.
December 11, 2021
Greenhorn451
where are you playing where you don't make it to turn six or seven?
December 8, 2021
Goop
The question you have to ask yourself is how long of a game are you planning to play. On average he's going to generate one bystander every 3 turns. So yeah on turn 6 you will have 2 clones and 3 perplexes and 3 probs on the field, thats really nice. However turn 6 is long time and most games are almost over by then. You can still use him for outwit and tk and he's still worth his points even if you only get a single pog out.
